item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul" -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent" -- Victor hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when, whatever be the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Nature is pitiless; she never withdraws her flowers, her music, her fragrance, and her sunlight from before human cruelty or suffering." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Laughter is sunshine, it chases winter from the human face." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved -- loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description:
"I wanted to see you again, touch you, know who you were, see if I would find you identical with the ideal image of you which had remained with me and perhaps shatter my dream with the aid of reality.
-Claude Frollo " -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "Take an old man's word; there's nothing worse than a muddle in all the world. It is easy to face Death and Fate, and the things that sound so dreadful. It is on my muddles that I look back with horror - on the things that I might have avoided. We can help one another but little. I used to think I could teach young people the whole of life, but I know better now, and all my teaching of George has come down to this: beware of muddle." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "It is fate that I am here,' George persisted, 'but you can call it Italy if it makes you less unhappy." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Merrilee add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Earth's crammed with heaven, And every common bush afire with God, But only he who sees takes off his shoes; The rest sit round and pluck blackberries." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "God's gifts put men's best dreams to shame." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Merrilee add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "My sun sets to rise again." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning
